intro: Phyllanthus pachycarpus, commonly known as the thick-fruited phyllanthus, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, green leaves with a slightly waxy texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by fleshy, red berries that are edible. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is cultivated in some parts of the world.
